article.title: What To Buy In Incheon Airport
article.lead_paragraph: As one of the biggest and the busiest airports in the world, the Seoul - Incheon International Airport in South Korea is more like a grand mall packed with bustling passengers. Enclosing an in-house golf course, a casino, an ice skating rink, a spa, and a cultural museum, the airport is nothing short of a destination in itself. It also has a remarkably high number of brand outlets and shopping marts that give the passengers a slew of options to shop from. You can get the best of South Korean products and souvenirs at slashed prices in duty-free marts present here. If you are clueless about what to buy in Incheon Airport, look no further. If you're looking for what to buy in Incheon Airport, here are six things that should definitely be on your shopping list when you are here.

snippets.title: 1. Honey butter chips
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BpzUAuSlfx2/

Eating a pack of these subtly sweet flavored potato chips will induce a frenzy in you, something that is popularly known as the "Honey-Butter craze" among the South Koreans. This fried buttery snack is extensively sold in the South Korean market and is delightfully savored by a large group of people here. To put it in perspective, the demand is so huge that some stores make Honey Butter Chip customer waiting lists and limit the selling quantity to one pack per person. Owing to this craze, a Honey Butter Chip hunting app was launched in early 2015 to show the product's availability in stores. You should definitely get your hands on a pack of these chips to try the unique taste for yourself and see.

> #### LOTTE Mart
>
> **Address**:  3rd Fl. Incheon International Airport Departure Lounge, 2851, Unseo-dong, Jung-gu, Incheon
>
> **Price**: from 2500 KRW (2.30 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**: 06:30 to 21:30
>
> **Website** : [Lotte Mart](http://en.lottedfs.com/branchGuide/7/intro)

snippets.title: 2. Innisfree facial masks
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BQrgGgiAM2G/

These mask sheets from Innisfree are the South Koreans' first choice to brighten their skin. Renowned to be produced from natural elements found in the pristine island of Jeju in the Korean Strait, these mask sets have a variety of flavors ranging from Acai Berry to shea butter. With its moisturizing ingredients and essences, these facial masks are sure to soothe and increase the vitality of your stressed skin.

> #### Innisfree
>
> **Address**:  Near Check-In Counter G on 3F, Terminal 1, Incheon International Airport
>
> **Price**: from 1350 KRW (1.20 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**: 06:30 - 21:00
>
>**Website** : [Innisfree](http://www.innisfreeworld.com)

snippets.title: 4. Red ginseng
snippets.description:
Extracted from a plant that grows in South Korea, red ginseng roots have a myriad of health remedies and healing properties. This Asian herb is famous among South Koreans for its medicinal properties and is known for prolonging life, improving body vigor, and curing health issues like ulcers, diabetes, stress, aging and inflammations. Used as a traditional medicine for centuries, it can be infused in teas and soups and is a very effective cure for your mental health ailments as well. This is one highly prized product that you will find in Incheon and something that is highly recommended to be carried along with you when you leave the city.

> #### Jeonggwanjang (Korea Ginseng Corporation)
>
> **Address**: Near Check-In Counter G on 3F, Terminal 1
>
> **Price**: from 45000 KRW (40 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**: 06:30 - 21:00
>
> **Website** : [Korea Ginseng Corporation](https://www.kgcus.com/)

snippets.title: 5. Seaweed
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BiLyl5hFRyB/

This edible red alga is widely cultivated and consumed as a side dish in South Korea. They make up for a very healthy diet abundant in proteins and essential amino acids. Korean Rice rolls (Gimbaps), Seaweed salads (Miyeouk Muchim) and Seaweed Soups (Miyeouk Guk) are famous dishes with seaweed that are enjoyed by the South Koreans. You can get a pack of seaweed to either just snack on like chips or to add to your recipes when you get back home. Traditionally, South Koreans have also used seaweed as a gift to give their loved ones during events such as the Lunar New Year, and this is one ideal souvenir that you can get your folks back home.
 
> #### LOTTE Mart
>
> **Address**: 3rd Fl. Incheon International Airport Departure Lounge, 2851, Unseo-dong, Jung-gu, Incheon
>
> **Price**: from 5500 KRW (4.90 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**: 06:30 - 21:00
>
> **Website** : [Lotte Mart](http://en.lottedfs.com/branchGuide/7/intro)

snippets.title: 6. Sulwhasoo Products
snippets.description:
https://www.instagram.com/p/BkzcmDkhfos/

The luxury skin-care brand Sulwhasoo has its line of products made by a combination of some of the finest Korean herbal ingredients. They are an excellent solution to renew your skin's youthful nature and vitalize it. With a massive following of loyal customers in South Korea, Sulwhasoo is well known for its proprietary set of ingredients that restores the skin's balance. These products are used worldwide for their use of ancient Asian wisdom of skin treatment using herbs and are something you should not miss out on buying before you leave Incheon

> #### Shilla Duty Free (Sulwhasoo)
>
> **Address**:  Near Gate 252 on 3F, Terminal 2, Incheon Airport
>
> **Price**: from 22500 KRW (20 USD)
>
> **Opening Hours**: 06:50 - 21:30
>
> **Website** : [Sulwhasoo](https://www.sulwhasoo.com/int/en/)
